{{Chinese name|[[Yao (surname)|Yao]]}} {{Infobox person | name = Yao Defen (姚德芬) | image = | birth_date = {{birth date|1972|7|15}} | birth_place = [[Shucheng]], [[Liuan]], [[Anhui]], [[China]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2012|11|13|1972|7|15}} | death_place = China | known_for = Tallest living woman (former; deceased)
World record holder | height = {{height|m=2.34|precision=0}}[http://dailymotion.alice.it/relevance weight = 144.2 kg /search/tallest%2Bwoman/video/x64w5h_guinness-world-recors-tallest-woman_lifestyle measured at 234 cm] ''[[Ultimate Guinness World Records]]'' tv series }} '''Yao Defen''' ({{zh|c=姚德芬|p=Yáo Défēn}}) of [[China]], (July 15, 1972 – November 13, 2012{{cite web |url=http://news.bandao.cn/news_html/201211/20121115/news_20121115_2021148.shtml |title=皖籍"世界第一女巨人"姚德芬去世|女性|半岛网 |publisher=News.bandao.cn |date=2012-11-15 |accessdate=2012-12-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121209061807/http://news.bandao.cn/news_html/201211/20121115/news_20121115_2021148.shtml |archivedate=2012-12-09 |df= }}) was the tallest living woman, as recognized by [[Guinness World Records]].[[Craig Glenday|Glenday, Craig]] (ed.) ''Guinness World Records 2011.'' Guinness World Records, 2010. She stood at 234 centimetres (7 ft 8 in) tall, weighed {{convert|144|kg|lb}}, and had size 23 (US) feet.{{cite web|url=http://www.theepochtimes.com/news/6-3-11/39150.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060716102137/https://www.theepochtimes.com/news/6-3-11/39150.html |archivedate=2006-07-16|title=The Biggest Wish of Asia's Tallest Woman |publisher=Theepochtimes.com |date=2006-03-11 }} Her [[gigantism]] was due to a tumor in her [[pituitary gland]]. ==Early life== Yao Defen was born to poor farmers in the town of [[Liuan]] in the [[Anhui]] province of [[Shucheng]] County. At birth she weighed {{convert|2.8|kg|lb}}. When she was eleven years old she was about 180 centimetres (6 ft 2 in) tall. She was 206 centimetres (6 ft 9 in) tall by the age of fifteen years. The story of this "woman giant" began to spread rapidly after she went to see a doctor at the age of fifteen years for an illness. Medical doctors (who also saw her after years) properly diagnosed the illness but decided not to cure her, because her family did not have the 4000 [[Chinese yuan|yuan]] for the surgery.Discovery document, part of "My shocking story" film series. After that, many companies attempted to train her to be a sports star. The plans were abandoned, however, because Yao was too weak. Because she was illiterate, since 1992 Defen earned a living by traveling with her father and performing. Yao's giant stature was caused by a condition called [[acromegaly]], wherein a large tumor in the pituitary gland of the brain releases too much growth hormone and causes excessive growth. Around 2002 a hospital in Guangzhou Province removed the tumor. In 2009, the [[TLC (TV channel)|TLC]] cable TV network devoted a whole night's show to her. She fell in her home and had internal bleeding of the brain. She recovered and felt some happiness after a visit from China's tallest man, [[Zhang Juncai]]. ==Medical help== A British television program filmed a documentary on her and helped raise money so she could get proper medical care. Two leading doctors in [[acromegaly]] agreed to help Yao. In that hospital, her growth hormone was greatly slowed down, although it remained a problem. Upon her return home to her mother and brother, she was able to walk with crutches, unassisted by others, and was given a six-month supply of medicines and supplements in hopes of improving her condition enough to undergo surgery. == Death == Yao died on November 13, 2012 at the age of 40 from an unspecified ailment.{{cite web|title=World's tallest woman, 39, dies in China|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-204_162-57557215/worlds-tallest-woman-39-dies-in-china/|publisher=cbsnews|accessdate=5 December 2012}} {{s-start}} {{succession box | title = [[List of tallest people|Tallest Recognized Woman]] | years = 2008-2012 | before = [[Sandy Allen]] | after = Sun Fang }} {{s-end}} ==See also== * [[List of tallest people]] * [[Sultan Kösen]], tallest living man * [[Zeng Jinlian]], the tallest woman in medical history, also from China * [[Sun Fang]], tallest living woman in the world, now. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://shanghaiist.com/2006/03/21/yao_defen_the_t.php World's Tallest Woman] {{DEFAULTSORT:Yao, Defen}} [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:2012 deaths]] [[Category:People from Lu'an]] [[Category:People with gigantism]]
